intro: Macrocentrum repens, commonly known as the spreading centipede plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and vibrant, tubular flowers. The plant produces showy, often colorful blooms that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are succulent and capable of rooting at the nodes. Macrocentrum repens is often cultivated as a ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ease of care.
